results.title: The Volley, lob and overhead with Billie Jean King
results.creator_credit: Johnson-Nyquist Productions and Henry Ushijima Films

Episode of Series “On tennis”

results.title: The Voices of a string quartet
results.creator_credit: Nina Collier, Lee R. Bobker, Arts and Audiences and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Introduces the instruments of the string quartet and indicates their similarities and differences. Presents selections in a variety of moods, including musical imitations of brasses, organ and harp. Performing artists: The Juilliard String Quartet.

results.title: The Voice of the people
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, AFTRS and Ian Allen
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the powerful influence of the television media and argues that it has the ability to misrepresent the opinions of the community through editorial licence. A man’s comments are edited so severely on the evening news that his viewpoint is totally misrepresented and his reaction is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, AFTRS and Ian Allen

results.title: The Voice of the organ. No. 4
results.brief_description: Community hymn singing - hymns are sung by the choir of HMS Woolverstone whilst an unseen narrator encourages the audience to join in. The words are displayed on illustrated cards. At the organ, Fredric Bayco.

results.title: The Voice of Ivan Frost
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Ann Shenfield, Robert Stephenson, Paul Fletcher and Alanya Van De Wiel
results.brief_description: In a surreal industrial landscape populated by equally bizarre characters, the magical voice of celebrated singer Ivan Frost has the power to make people wish for death. In a remote village elsewhere, Alfonso Pellegrini, a shepherd with an astonishing musical talent, longs to leave his sheep and go in search of the fabulous sounds described in books. Being invited to play beside the remarkable singer, Alfonso is saddened to find himself thrust into the background, his precious violin broken from trying to compete for attention. Ivan’s world is similarly turned upside down when he awakens to find his voice gone and a scar across his chest. Without his legendary voice to bewitch the masses and open doors for him, he is forced to confront the nightmarish reality of his situation - alone.

results.title: The Voice in the fingers
results.brief_description: Introduces Highland music in its natural and historical environment. Shows the different types of this music and its impact on the music outside Scotland.
